text: Concrete slab meets minimum compressive strength (typically ≥ 3000 psi)
Mix design reviewed for compatibility with polishing system (low air, minimal SCMs)
Slab poured flat with minimal crown/camber (FF/FL targets if specified)
No curing compounds or surface sealers used unless approved for polishing
Protection from early trades removed; surface cleaned of glue, coatings, or debris
Cracks and divots patched with compatible filler prior to grinding
Areas with embedded items or poor coverage identified and masked (if needed)
Initial metal bond grinding completed per manufacturer’s step sequence
Joints and cracks filled and flush post-initial grind
Densifier applied and allowed to penetrate per manufacturer’s dwell time
Intermediate and fine diamond polishing passes completed in sequence
Polished to specified gloss level (typically 400 / 800 / 1500 / 3000 grit)
Guard/sealer (if used) applied evenly with no streaks
Edges and corners polished to match field finish
Traffic protection measures applied after polishing (mats, warnings)
No swirl marks, haze, or inconsistent polish across zones

id: • ACI 310R, ASTM E430, C150, ASTM C1028, NFPA 101
• Manufacturer Specs: RetroPlate, Ashford Formula, Prosoco, Ameripolish, Laticrete
